intro: Agrostophyllum planicaule, commonly known as the flat-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its slender, often sprawling stems. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruit. Agrostophyllum planicaule is native to parts of South America and is often found in humid, tropical environments.
